to control other applications, such as Final Cut Pro.

follow the prompts to allow CommandPost accessibility access.

en.watchFolderFCPMediaHelp: This feature allows you to recieve macOS notfications whenever supported files are added into any of the below watch folders. From the notification you can then Import these files directly to your current Final Cut Pro timeline. If you hold down SHIFT when pressing Import, it will import all the outstanding files.

en.rebuildCompleteMessage: CommandPost has successfully built the Tangent Control Map.
en.rebuildControlMapMessage:
Please be aware that when you rebuild the Control Map this will affect your custom layouts in Tangent Mapper as plugins and effects may have been added, removed, renamed or re-ordered.

Any previous Control Maps will be backed up in the same folder, which you can manually restore if needed.
en.rebuildControlMapTakesTimes: It can take a few minutes to build the Control Map once you click OK, and this dialog box may stay visible during this time.
en.existingControlMapDoesNotExist: An existing control map does not exist.
en.commandLineToolDescription: When the Command Line Tool is installed, you can use cmdpost in Terminal to trigger Lua code. Please refer to the User Guide for more information.

en.cpFeatureRequest_title: Suggest Final Cut Pro Feature to Apple
en.tangentPreferencesInfo:
CommandPost offers native support of the entire range of Tangent's panels, including the Element, Wave, Ripple, the Element-Vs iPad app, and any future panels.

All actions within CommandPost can be assigned to any Tangent panel button/wheel using Tangent's Mapper application. This allows you to create your own layouts and modes.

If you add a new effect or plugin in Final Cut Pro, or change Languages, you can use the Rebuild Control Map button below to make these new items appear in Tangent Mapper. Please be aware that when you rebuild the Control Map this will affect your custom layouts in Tangent Mapper as plugins and effects may have been added, removed, renamed or re-ordered.

en.commandSetText:
CommandPost has the optional ability to let you to manage and control its shortcuts through the Final Cut Pro Command Editor, instead of its built-in Shortcut Manager.

Using this feature requires your administrator password and requires Final Cut Pro to restart.

It doesn't look like you have a Default Destination selected.

You can set a Default Destination by going to 'Preferences', clicking the 'Destinations' tab, right-clicking on the Destination you would like to use and then click 'Make Default'.

You can set a Batch Export Destination Preset via the CommandPost menubar.
